TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , whose particulars are set out in the appendix , are NORP nationals . They are the parents and siblings of Mr ORG who disappeared in DATE . The applicants were represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG and as they appear from the documents submitted by them , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG was performing his military service in the town of GPE when he went missing . No information was given to the family about his disappearance by the military authorities and the family became aware of it when his father PERSON – who is the first applicant – tried to contact him .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG petitioned the NORP prosecutor and asked the prosecutor to find his son . On DATE the prosecutor concluded that ORG had not disappeared but gone absent without leave ( ORG ) , and closed the investigation . The prosecutor ’s decision was communicated to Mr Özsüren on DATE .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , and on subsequent dates , steps were taken by the military authorities to find ORG who , in their opinion , had gone AWOL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant , ORG , sent a letter to the commander of ORG , and asked for his son to be found . Pursuant to Mr Özsüren ’s request an administrative investigation was conducted at the military barracks where ORG disappeared , but that investigation did not yield any results . The investigators recommended that military judges instigate a judicial investigation .
CARDINAL . In DATE the military authorities instituted a criminal case against ORG for having gone AWOL , and issued a warrant for his arrest .
CARDINAL . Nothing has been heard from ORG since his disappearance and the criminal proceedings against him are still pending in absentia .
